copy.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The number that should be mirrored.

*See also: [Copy Number](https://esphome.io/components/copy.html#copy-number)*

modbus_controller.docs:
The `modbus_controller` platform creates a Number from a modbus_controller. When the Number is updated a modbus write command is created sent to the device.

*See also: [Modbus Controller Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/modbus_controller.html#modbus-controller-number)*

template.docs:
The `template` number platform allows you to create a number with templated values using [lambdas](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-lambda).

*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#template-number)*

tuya.docs:
The `tuya` number platform allows you to create a number that controls a tuya serial component. This platform requires [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html) to be configured.

*See also: [Tuya Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/tuya.html#tuya-number)*

on_value.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when a new value is published. See [on_value](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-on-value).



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#base-number-configuration)*

above.docs:
**float**: The minimum for the trigger.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#on-value-range)*

below.docs:
**float**: The maximum for the trigger.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#on-value-range)*

on_value_range.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when a published value transition from outside to a range to inside. See [on_value_range](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-on-value-range).



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#base-number-configuration)*

unit_of_measurement.docs:
**string**: Manually set the unit of measurement for the number. Requires Home Assistant Core 2021.12 or newer.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#base-number-configuration)*

mode.docs:
**string**: Defines how the number should be displayed in the frontend. See [https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/number/#properties](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/number/#properties) for a list of available options. Requires Home Assistant Core 2021.12 or newer. Defaults to `"auto"`.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#base-number-configuration)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the number to set.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-set-action)*

value.docs:
**float, [templatable](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-templatable)**: The value to set the number to.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-set-action)*

set.docs:
You can also set the number for the template number from elsewhere in your YAML file with the [number.set Action](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-set-action).

*See also: [Template Number](https://esphome.io/components/number/template.html#number-set-action)*

above.docs:
**float**: The minimum for the condition.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-in-range-condition)*

below.docs:
**float**: The maximum for the condition.



*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-in-range-condition)*

in_range.docs:
This condition passes if the state of the given number is inside a range.

*See also: [Number Component](https://esphome.io/components/number/index.html#number-in-range-condition)*
